文档节点.标题: From Local to Global: A Graph RAG Approach to Query-Focused Summarization
文档节点.摘要: This work presents a Graph RAG approach to question answering over private text corpora that scales with both the generality of user questions and the quantity of source text to be indexed. The approach uses an LLM to build a graph-based text index in two stages: first to derive an entity knowledge graph from the source documents, then to pre-generate community summaries for all groups of closely-related entities. Given a question, each community summary is used to generate a partial response, before all partial responses are again summarized in a final response to the user. For a class of global sensemaking questions over datasets in the 1 million token range, the approach shows substantial improvements over a naïve RAG baseline for both the comprehensiveness and diversity of generated answers.

RAG组件节点.描述: Uses an LLM to build a graph-based text index by deriving an entity knowledge graph from source documents and pre-generating community summaries for groups of closely-related entities.
Retrieves relevant community summaries based on the user query.
Generates partial responses from community summaries and then summarizes all partial responses into a final response.

RAG流程节点.描述: A global approach to RAG that combines knowledge graph generation, retrieval-augmented generation, and query-focused summarization to support human sensemaking over entire text corpora.
